Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael McGowan'], 'Producers': ['Michael McGowan', 'Jody Colero', 'Avi Federgreen', 'Tamara Deverell'], 'Starring': ['James Cromwell', 'Genevieve Bujold', 'Campbell Scott'], 'Studio': ['SAMUEL GOLDWYN FILMS LLC.']}
Review Text: I was torn between a four and five star rating. I considered 4 due to some unnecessary elements and length. But, I still have to give it a five. I really appreciated the portrayal of lifelong love, commitment, and the character development in this film. It seemed a bit long...but maybe that is because these filmmakers stayed true to the reality of these lives, instead of giving into the overly-dramatic, cheap, Hollywood-ism that is so prevalent in film today. Overall...well done. My husband and I truly enjoyed it.
Review Title: Had To Lean To The Five
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2015/05/02
Average Rating: 4.3
Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Steven Suderman'], 'Producers': ['Steven Suderman'], 'Studio': ['FilmBuff']}
Review Text: This is not a "How to" per se. It is more about the heart and soul, and struggles, of farming. Though we felt the film was a bit slow in some places, it is insightful and we enjoyed it very much. I particularly enjoyed watching the "animal mommy," as I've dubbed her. She is really amazing. Thank you to everyone who had a part in the making of this film. Well done.
Review Title: A Beautiful Education
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Mystery of the Shemitah Unlocked: The 3,000-Year-Old Mystery That Holds the Secret of America's Future, the World's Future, and Your Future!
Review Date: 2015/06/22
Store: Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Faith & Spirituality
Product Description: ['Based on the', 'New York Times', 'Best Seller', 'The Mystery of the Shemitah', 'From the author that brought you', 'NEW YORK TIMES', 'best sellers', 'The Book of Mysteries', ',', 'The Harbinger', ', and', 'The Paradigm', 'with over 3 MILLION copies sold', 'IS IT POSSIBLE THERE EXISTS A 3,000-YEAR-OLD MYSTERY THAT…', 'Is determining America’s future, the world’s future—and your future?Has determined the rise and fall of the economy and the collapse of Wall Street?Has pinpointed the greatest stock market crashes in history down to their exact dates?Foretells the rise and fall of nations and what may be the coming fall of America?Warns of a coming calamity and how to prepare for it?\xa0 This riveting documentary DVD based on Jonathan Cahn’s', 'New York Times', 'bestsellingbook', 'The Mystery of the Shemitah', 'reveals the seven-year mystery that isessential to understand the past, the present, and the future, and holds the missingkey to end-time prophecy.\xa0 PLUS - Over fifty minutes of bonus features that go deeper into the mystery, whatlies ahead, and how you can be ready.', 'The Mystery of the Shemitah Unlocked', 'will amaze, stun, forewarn,and prepare you for what lies ahead…and it may just change your life.']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Documentary/Religion', 'Format': 'NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Cahn, Jonathan', 'Runtime': '55 minutes', 'Subtitle': "The 3,000-Year-Old Mystery That Holds the Secret of America's Future, the World's Future, and Your Future!The 3,000-Year-Old Mystery That Holds the Secret of America's Future, the World's Future, and Your Future!   See more", 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.4 x 7.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '072270', 'Media Format': 'NTSC', 'Run time': '55 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 31, 2015', 'Studio': 'Frontline', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I'm going to give this a 4 for those who just won't read the book. It is worth your while to get. But, if you've seen the programs, interviews, and read the books, there is not really any new information here. I bought it because I thought he was going to give some in depth advice on preparing (as the description suggests) after perhaps interviewing some professionals and alluding to what he is doing himself. But, while the spiritual preparation part was wise (and hopefully obvious)...there was little else beyond that. My only question is...how can you accurately, and with certainty, count Shemitah's if you cannot be sure when the Jubilee (50th) year is? It's not an accusation, it's just an observation. However, as history shows, there have been significant collapses during the periods noted by Cahn...so worthwhile knowledge, either way.
Review Title: If You Just Won't Read...
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------

Categories: Drama, Military and War
Product Description: ["It is 1775. Henry Felder, a Swiss-German colonist, lives with his family in the British colony of South Carolina. After many years of struggling with corrupt British rulers, Felder is urged by the new patriot governor to write Articles of Separation from the English King. Felder's old Indian fighting comrade forms a Tory militia to assist the Crown as the fight heats up."]

Review Text: We enjoy documentaries, the Bible, Israel, etc. This seemed as if it would be a good marriage of these in one nice package. Unfortunately, we got 11 minutes into the film and decided to abandon it. The cinematography and editing were poor to the point of distraction, and I felt as if I'd been tricked into watching home movies of a stranger's vacation. What a shame. It could have been so much more.

Review Text: We enjoy documentaries, the Bible, Israel, etc. This seemed as if it would be a good marriage of these in one nice package. Unfortunately, we got 11 minutes into the film and decided to abandon it. The cinematography and editing were poor to the point of distraction, and I felt as if I'd been tricked into watching home movies of a stranger's vacation. What a shame. It could have been so much more.

Review Text: (Note: I did not buy this movie via Amazon and is no reflection of them.) Animated woman grabbing and flaunting her breasts, a 666 reference, and so much more. I am stunned that this trash is what passes for children's entertainment. It should be PG-13 at the very least...and I'm not sure I'd be comfortable with that. I'd burn it, except the fumes might be as noxious as the movie itself. In the trash it will go, posthaste.

Review Text: I was looking up “health documentaries” on Amazon and found this powerful piece. It is worth everyone’s time, whether you have MS or not, as it is a good reminder to eat healthy, be careful of where you donate your time and resources, and to be your own best advocate.

Review Text: I’ve rarely seen good potential slayed so gruesomely. If you think a race to the bottom is entertaining, then this film is for you. I only gave it two stars because the acting was decent and the story idea was intriguing. I couldn’t even watch the whole film. What a waste.

target_interaction.title: Remember To Breathe
target_interaction.text: This is an incredibly intense movie. Superbly acted, masterfully directed, and discretely edited. I felt like I was there and was never taken out of the story for a moment by poor lighting, ridiculous costumes  or overwrought sound. To think it was based on real life events is humbling—our world would be a very different place today without these heroes. As for the movie itself; I don’t know what one could possibly want more in a drama film. Well done to every single person who brought this story to life!
description: Benedict Cumberbatch (DOCTOR STRANGE) and Rachel Brosnahan ("The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel") star in this true-life Cold War spy thriller about British businessman Greville Wynne, who must form an alliance with a Soviet spy to prevent a nuclear confrontation.
